Passive Voice in German

In German, passive voice is rarely used in everyday speech, but it's common in official or formal situations.
What is passive voice?
When the action is more important than the person doing it.
Examples:
I play cricket → Cricket is played.
I eat pizza → Pizza will be eaten.
In English, passive voice uses 'to be' and the past participle:
Pizza is eaten.
Pepsi is drunk.

Passive Voice Structure in German

In German, the English 'to be' is replaced with werden (not sein!) plus the past participle.
Examples:
It is done – Es wird gemacht.
Pizza is eaten – Pizza wird gegessen.
Pepsi is drunk – Pepsi wird getrunken.
Cars are driven – Autos werden gefahren.

Passive Voice with 'by' (von)

In passive sentences, if you mention 'by' to show the doer of the action, use von in German.
Examples:
Pizza is cooked by Ovi – Pizza wird von Ovi gekocht.
The book is read by Hasan – Das Buch wird von Hasan gelesen.
Remember: werden is conjugated, the main verb goes to the end as a participle.

Passive Voice with Modal Verbs

When using modal verbs (can, must, should) with the passive:

  • Pizza can be eaten – Pizza kann gegessen werden.
  • Cricket can be played – Cricket kann gespielt werden.
  • Tea must be drunk – Tee muss getrunken werden.
  • German should be learned – Deutsch soll gelernt werden.
The participle and werden always move to the end.

Summary

  • Passive means the action is most important.
  • Use werden plus past participle (not sein!).
  • Use von for 'by' in passive sentences.
  • With modals: Modal is conjugated, past participle + werden at end.
  • Examples: Pizza wird gegessen. Tee muss getrunken werden. Das Buch wird von Hasan gelesen.
